metadata.title: FA Understand 26 04

config.question: Which of the following was true of minorities and union membership during the depression?

choices.content: Latinos joined unions in record numbers.
African American union membership remained extremely low.
The depression had little impact on union membership for minorities.
African American union membership increased significantly.

answer_3.response: Consider This: Despite impressive gains, only 28 percent of all Americans (excluding farmworkers) belonged to unions by 1940. Millions in the restaurant, retail, and service trades remained unorganized, working long hours for low wages. Employer resistance and traditional hostility to unions blocked progress, as did the aloof attitude of FDR. See L.O. 26.4 The Impact of the New Deal.
